result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Davila-Gali

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn and Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Jose Davila-Gali. Defendant Jose Davila-Gali not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed by 12-5-2022.  Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Jose Davila-Gali. Defendant Jose Davila-Gali not in court, in custody.   Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defense awaiting additional discovery materials from the state and request an additional scheduling date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jose Davila-Gali in court with Attorney Colin McGinn.  Defendant Jose Davila-Gali in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi. Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for an Arraignment. Original Information received and e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defense request matter set for additional hering. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Case assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28 in error. Case has been reassigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner.

Defendant Jose Davila-Gali in court by video with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn who appears in person.  Defendant Jose Davila-Gali in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Saavedra. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28. Arraignment scehded for 8/18/2022 at 9am Br 28 Judge Sanders.
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney McGinn and Attorney Richardson have been appointed to this case. Hearing date of 7/13/2022 in Br. 28 is vacated. Next court date will be 7/20/22 at 8:30am for a preliminary hearing. Parties are notified. State to send a subpoena to their witness.
Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jose Davila-Gali in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Court was notified via electronic mail on today's date that the Public Defender's office has not yet appointed counsel and requested additional time.
Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Previously sworn as interpreter:  Sarah Chwaszczewski
Received and Filed. SPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant Jose Davila-Gali not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE Hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring;  24/7 hour curfew with the exception of verified employment, medical and legal appointments.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1,000,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Svensson, Fred

Defendant Jose Davila-Gali in court with attorney Julita Kishma de Leon.  Defendant Jose Davila-Gali in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jose Davila-Gali appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
   99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
